com.googlecode.sarasvati

Interface Arc

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HibArc, MemArc

    public interface Arc
    Arcs describe the relationships between Nodes. Arcs are directed links between Nodes. During the execution of a GraphProcess, arcs will determine in what order tokens are generated in Nodes. Arc may be labeled with a name. The name can be used for flow control.
    Author:
    Paul Lorenz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DEFAULT_ARC
      If no name is specified for an Arc, it will be given the default name, which is null.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node getEndNode()
      Returns the Node at the end of the arc.
      String getName()
      Returns the arc name.
      Node getStartNode()
      Returns the Node at the start of the arc.
      boolean isSelfArc()
      Returns true if the start node is the same as the end node, false otherwise.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_ARC

        static final String DEFAULT_ARC
        If no name is specified for an Arc, it will be given the default name, which is null.

    • Method Detail

      • getStartNode

        Node getStartNode()
        Returns the Node at the start of the arc.
        Returns:
        The Node at the start of the arc

      • getEndNode

        Node getEndNode()
        Returns the Node at the end of the arc.
        Returns:
        The Node at the end of the arc

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the arc name. Nulls and blanks are allowed, but care should be taken as some databases have issues with blanks and treat them either as nulls or as single spaces.
        Returns:
        The arc name.

      • isSelfArc

        boolean isSelfArc()
        Returns true if the start node is the same as the end node, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the start node is the same as the end node, false otherwise.
